info.title: Inventory Management
info.description: Maintaining up-to-date inventory for items on Walmart.com ensures a great customer experience as well as greater sales opportunities. The Inventory Management APIs allow management of current or recently changed inventory supply.

get.description: Gets the inventory for a given item.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the DSV, which identifies each item. This will be used by the DSV in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’, '{', '}' as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

parameters.name: WM_SEC.TIMESTAMP
parameters.description: The Epoch timestamp

parameters.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
parameters.description: The vendor's digital signature, generated by running the JAR file or custom generation code

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
parameters.description: A unique ID required to access the API
parameters.example: Get the Consumer ID from Developer Center after logging in

sku.description: A DSV-provided Product ID. Response will have decoded value.

amount.description: The number available in the inventory

quantity.description: Information about the quantity in inventory

sku.description: A DSV-provided Product ID. Response will have decoded value.

amount.description: The number available in the inventory

quantity.description: Information about the quantity in inventory

put.description:
Updates the inventory for a given item. Use an Availability Code to identify how inventory quantity is managed for an item.

The Availability Code can be:

AC: Use for standard inventory updates. Assign this code to an item with normal inventory.
AA: Use for an item with infinite inventory that never runs out. If you set the Availability Code to AA, you don't need to provide the quantity.
PO: Use for a pre-order item.

parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

availabilityCode.description: Identifies how to manage the inventory update. AC: The code used for standard inventory updates. Assign this code to an item with normal inventory. AA: An item with infinite inventory. If you set AA as the Availability Code, you don't need to provide inventory for the item.

post.description: Updates inventory for items in bulk. Seller Can either use feed type "inventory" or "DSV_INVENTORY" * Inventory spec 1.4 feed type: inventory * Inventory spec 1.5 feed type: DSV_INVENTORY Please Note: Multi Node Inventory Update Feed (feedType=DSV_INVENTORY) only supports JSON Request and Responses. Refer to "DSV_MultiNode_Bulk_Inventory_Update_Request.json" for the corresponding request sample Refer to the guide section for more detailed guide around each of the feed types Refer to the throttling limits before uploading the Feed Files.

parameters.name: feedType
parameters.description: The feed Type

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated.  Not required in case of Multi Node Inventory Update Feed (feedType=MP_INVENTORY)
